import numpy as np # linear algebra

import plotly.express as px
import seaborn as sns

import plotly.offline as py
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

#Code by Aishwarya Wuntkal https://www.kaggle.com/aishu2218/breast-cancer-prediction-using-svm/comments

trace = go.Pie(labels = ['IN SITU','MALIGNANT'], values = df['BEHAVIOUR_CODE_DESC'].value_counts(), 
               textfont=dict(size=15), opacity = 0.8,
               marker=dict(colors=['pink', 'purple'], 
               line=dict(color='#000000', width=1.5)))
           

layout= go.Layout(
        title={
        'text': "Distribution of Behaviour Code Description",
        'y':0.9,
        'x':0.5,
        'xanchor': 'center',
        'yanchor': 'top'})

fig = go.Figure(data = [trace], layout=layout)
fig.show()
source.c4702cb5:
#Code from Gabriel Preda
#plt.style.use('dark_background')
def plot_count(feature, title, df, size=1):
    f, ax = plt.subplots(1,1, figsize=(4*size,4))
    total = float(len(df))
    g = sns.countplot(df[feature], order = df[feature].value_counts().index[:20], palette='PuRd')
    g.set_title("Number and percentage of {}".format(title))
    if(size > 2):
        plt.xticks(rotation=90, size=8)
    for p in ax.patches:
        height = p.get_height()
        ax.text(p.get_x()+p.get_width()/2.,
                height + 3,
                '{:1.2f}%'.format(100*height/total),
                ha="center") 
    plt.show()

#Code by Taha07  https://www.kaggle.com/taha07/data-scientists-jobs-analysis-visualization/notebook

plt.rcParams["figure.figsize"] = (12,9)
plt.style.use("classic")
color = plt.cm.PuRd(np.linspace(0,1,20))
df["DIAGNOSISYEAR"].value_counts().sort_values(ascending=False).head(20).plot.bar(color=color)
plt.title("Diagnosis Year of The Breast Cancer",fontsize=20)
plt.xlabel("Diagnosis Year",fontsize=15)
plt.ylabel("Count",fontsize=15)
plt.show()

##Code by Taha07  https://www.kaggle.com/taha07/data-scientists-jobs-analysis-visualization/notebook

from wordcloud import WordCloud
from wordcloud import STOPWORDS
stopwords = set(STOPWORDS)
wordcloud = WordCloud(background_color = 'pink',
                      height =2000,
                      width = 2000
                     ).generate(str(df["CCG_NAME"]))
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (12,12)
plt.axis("off")
plt.imshow(wordcloud)
plt.title("Clinical Commissioning Group Name")
plt.show()

source.20030cb2:
#Breast Cancer Awareness Month - October

October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month, an annual campaign to increase awareness of the disease. Join in the cause to help women in need today.https://www.nationalbreastcancer.org/breast-cancer-awareness-month
source.205b5fea:
#Variables included:

TUMOURPSEUDOID (project specific pseudonymised tumour identification number). 
 
AGECAT (age at diagnosis; 3 age categories: <40, 40-69, and >=70).

CCGCODE (code for Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG) of patient residence).

CCGNAME (name for CCG of patient residence).

DIAGNOSISMONTH (month of diagnosis; values range from 1 (January) to 12 (December)).

DIAGNOSISYEAR (year of diagnosis).

BEHAVIOURCODEDESC (description of tumour behaviour code; 2 values: in situ and malignant).

RANKVAR (differentiates between first and subsequent relevant tumours (for each patient); 2 values: first and subsequent).
